tool_description: Store any kind of JSON documents in a database according to a user permission context. Read, update or delete your docs.
name: JSON Storage API
title: JSON Storage API

api_list.name: deleteDataLakeItems
api_list.description: Delete one or more JSON documents from the DataLake by `Object.FilterItem.Identifier`, `Object.FilterItem.Name`, `Object.FilterItem.Creator.Identifier` or `Object.FilterItem.About['@type']`.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://json-storage-api.p.rapidapi.com/datalake"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "json-storage-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: createDataLakeItem
api_list.description: Store your JSON document to `Result.About` and save it as an item of our DataLake. Use `Result.Name` as identifier to categorize similar JSON resources if you want. Doing like this you can later filter your items by category name. Set `Result.Creator.Identifier` as ID to associate the DataLakeItem with a user context. Then you can search for all documents of this user by user ID.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://json-storage-api.p.rapidapi.com/datalake"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "json-storage-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: updateDataLakeItem
api_list.description: Use this endpoint to update an existing JSON document in the DataLake. Store your updated version of your JSON document to `Result.About`.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://json-storage-api.p.rapidapi.com/datalake"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "json-storage-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: readDataLakeItems
api_list.description: Retrieve one or more JSON documents from the DataLake by `Object.FilterItem.Identifier`, `Object.FilterItem.Name`, `Object.FilterItem.Creator.Identifier` or `Object.FilterItem.About['@type']`.
api_list.code:

        }

print(response.json())
